slide.text: "We wrote a piece of code (which is made of several Java commands) that changes the text that appears on a button."
"But we want to change the text on the button only after the user clicks it."
"To do so, we first give the piece of code we wrote a name. A piece of code with a name is called a function."
"We can now define that clicking the button calls the function and runs the piece of code inside it."
"Just like background color or font, onClick is also a property of the button View. It is a special property that allows us to choose which function will be called when the button is clicked."

exercise.question: "What function will be executed when the button is clicked?"
"What will be the text on the button after it\\u0027s clicked?"

task.text: "In the Code screen, wrap the commands your wrote with a function and give it a name. In the Design Screen, define the button\\u0027s OnClick property to be the function you created."
